text: Fresco by Piola, Villa Carola, Sori (Genoa). Photo by Paolo Monti, 1964 Paolo Gerolamo Piola (1666–1724) was an Italian painter of the Baroque period active mainly in Genoa. His father was the prominent Genoese painter, Domenico Piola. Paolo Gerolamo was very active painting sacred subjects and frescoes.Staatsgalerie of Stuttgart design exhibit. He was sent to study in Rome by his father, where he supposedly studied the work of Caracci, and studied under Carlo Maratta. Returning to Genoa, his father found his style ponderous. He was ultimately praised for his designs, and canvases for the church of Santa Maria di Carignano. ==References== Category:1666 births Category:1724 deaths Category:People from Genoa Category:17th-century Italian painters Category:Italian male painters Category:18th-century Italian painters Category:Genoese painters Category:Italian Baroque painters
